list_definition.definition: a type of strong alcoholic spirit made from wine

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: Brandy is usually drunk after dinner

list_ex_of_english: We did not order brandies and sodas, because we could not afford them, although now we are a bit more affluent.
By the same token, the mass noun brandy in (14a) necessarily has an existential reading.
But if the same half-bottle of medicinal brandy is put in the hands of a drunkard, who has already drunk three, it is excessive.
If we now made it a law that brandy must always be sold by quantity, we might do more harm than good.
Up until 1914, the paramount chief persisted in regarding brandy as the only cause of drunkenness in the country, contenting himself with appeals for the suppression of smuggling.
But 'judicious application of brandy both internally externally' assisted his recovery.
I am perfectly certain you cannot stop brandy, which is sent to this country in cases and barrels.
There has to be the brandy as well.
